TopicTitle: General advice: Do NOT buy KSP2 through Steam or Epic, buy it DRM-free from the PD store

Articles.Content:
Pretty much stated in the title.  Buying KSP2 directly from the Private Division store (currently) bypasses all the infuriating DRM content that Steam and Epic seem to have in their installs.  Given the experiences people have been having with the KSP1 PD launcher, I expect KSP2 to be annoyingly difficult to separate out from the Steam and Epic control mechanisms, especially when modding comes around.  So yeah, if you want to be sure of an easy experience with mods later on, avoid Steam and Epic.  Get it directly from PD.

Here's the link to KSP2 on the PD store for those interested: https://store.privatedivision.com/game/kerbal-space-program-2

Please note that I am not saying that you should not buy KSP2, I'm just saying that if you do want to buy it, get it through the PD store.
You can consider it DRM free even from steam and epic, as the game does not check anything and just runs (I moved it to a different PC after buying it on steam and it launched)
